text: I was running and some errands near to
the Westgate Mall when al-shabaab
militants attacked the mall this is
Tyler Hicks staff photographer at the
New York Times once I started to head
towards that direction I could
immediately see a steady stream of
people coming out no one knew what was
really going on at first I saw a woman
who had been shot in the foot
I was photographing her than heard more
screams and saw that more people were
being carried towards me it wasn't until
I was trying to move past the main
entrance that I saw a lifeless body of a
man laying at the steps I've never seen
anything like this and the years I've
been a photographer it's difficult to
grasp that reality but at the same time
you have to focus on making a document
of what's going on around you I was
positioned one floor up from where I saw
this woman who was hiding in a cafe the
position from where I was saying these
photographs was very exposed area the
police who were with me did not like me
being there but I felt it was an
important moment this isn't a violent
image but an image that shows the fear
obviously they had seen horrible things
and we're doing their best just to stay
put and stay out of sight
as we were moving around people would
occasionally suddenly flood out of a
store and in this case that the police
went and entered this casino and found
that there was a large group of people
inside this image really you can see the
desperation to move forward to get to an
exodus as quickly as they could one of
the big concerns here was that the
militants were trying to get out of the
mall among the regular civilians and and
it's believed that a number of them did
manage to get out that way and this
particular photograph people are moving
in the direction of a of a supermarket
and these kind of situations a lot of
ways this is when you get very honest
and true pictures because they're not
focused on you and they're doing just
doing their job this is a place that
I've shopped in many many times just as
I was going through the exit I saw that
there's the civilian had been shot
just next to the mascot of this
supermarket I was able to make just a
very quick couple of frames before I was
thrown out of the mall
in the days following the attack I
continued to try to cover the story
because there were so many people left
inside police an army created quite a
large cordon around the mall so it
became harder and harder to know what
was happening inside and this is this is
something that's very frustrating having
been in there and seeing people trying
to come out and knowing that there were
so many more people inside and not
knowing what was happening with them
[Music]
